timeline.bodyText:
Could you change "Executor" to have "executeCommandsWithResponse"? For all the old executors we have not converted yet, executeCommandsWithResponse could just call executeCommand and then return null.
That would get rid of this instanceof check.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal
dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: I made some small updates and I think it's better - YMMV :)
replies.author: jdeppe-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: It looks like these two default impls call each other. executeCommand calls executeCommandWithResponse and then it calls back to executeCommand. Seems like it would do an infinite recursion until the stack overflows.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: Yes, that is a danger. Once all commands are converted we can fix this.
replies.author: jdeppe-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: One other idea. I think the plan is to eventually have every executeCommand have a non-null response. But if we are going to continue to have some return "null" could they instead return an instance of RedisResponse to represents null?
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal

replies.bodyText: Will do once we switch the PUBLISH command which is the only one (I can think of) that would return null.
replies.author: jdeppe-pivotal

timeline.message: Review updates - No need for ResponseExecutor
Spotless...How do I love thee? Let me count the ways...

timeline.bodyText: can you fix this comment? I have seen this show up before. The comment does not even describe this constant. I would vote for just getting rid of the comment.
timeline.author: dschneider-pivotal
